articles.title: Alex Clippinger
articles.contents:
Alex Clippinger

                         Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            About Me
            Hello! I graduated from Northeastern University in 2019 with a degree in Mathematics and Economics. Since then, I’ve managed risk from extreme events at AIR Worldwide, helped farmers save money using in-season agriculture insights from drone imagery at Sentera, and volunteered with the Old Lyme Land Trust to understand high priority conservation areas in my home town.
            I am currently a Master of Environmental Data Science student at UCSB, where I hope to gain the necessary data science and analysis skills to support innovation and investment in sustainable practices and clean energy. I believe that economic principles, supported by data science and analytics, can be used to address the environmental challenges we now face. 
            
            
            Currently
            Data Scientist (Part-Time) @ RDN, Inc. 
            Graduate Student @ Bren School of Environmental Science & Management 
            Teaching Assistant @ UCSB Department of Economics
            
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Alex Clippinger

              I am currently a Master of Environmental Data Science student at UCSB, where I hope to gain the necessary data science and analysis skills to support innovation and investment in sustainable practices and clean energy.
